info.title: TWIN Workbench Server
info.description: REST API for TWIN - API Server.

tags.name: Info
tags.description: Information endpoints for the REST server.

tags.name: Authentication
tags.description: Authentication endpoints for the REST server.

tags.name: Identity
tags.description: Service to provide all features related to digital identity.

tags.name: Identity Profile
tags.description: Service to provide all features related to digital identity profiles.

tags.name: Blob Storage
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access a blob storage contract.

tags.name: Telemetry
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access a telemetry contract.

tags.name: Logging
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access a logging contract.

tags.name: NFT
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access an NFT contract.

tags.name: Attestation
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access an attestation contract.

tags.name: Auditable Item Graph
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access an auditable item graph contract.

tags.name: Auditable Item Stream
tags.description: Endpoints which are modelled to access an auditable item stream contract.

get.summary: Get the information for the server

200.description: The information about the server.

informationResponse.summary: The response for the information request.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

get.summary: Query graph vertices by id or alias

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id or alias to try and find.

parameters.name: idMode
parameters.description: Which field to look in with the id, defaults to both.

parameters.name: conditions
parameters.description: The conditions to filter the streams, JSON stringified IComparator[].

parameters.name: orderBy
parameters.description: The order for the results, default to dateCreated.

parameters.name: orderByDirection
parameters.description: The direction for the order, defaults to desc.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: The properties to return as a comma separated list, defaults to "id,dateCreated,aliases,annotationObject".

parameters.name: cursor
parameters.description: The optional cursor to get next chunk.

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The maximum number of entities in a page.

200.description: The response to getting the a list of the vertices with matching ids or aliases.

400.description: The server cannot process the request, see the content for more details.

401.description: You are not authorized to use the API or no credentials were supplied, see the content for more details.

get.summary: Get a graph vertex

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the vertex to get.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted aliases, resource, edges, defaults to false.

parameters.name: includeChangesets
parameters.description: Whether to include the changesets of the vertex, defaults to false.

parameters.name: verifySignatureDepth
parameters.description: How many signatures to verify, none, current or all, defaults to "none".

parameters.description: The direction for the order, defaults to desc.

get.summary: Get a stream

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the stream to get.

parameters.name: includeEntries
parameters.description: Whether to include the entries, defaults to false. The entries will be limited to the first page of entries in date descending order. If you want to get more entries you can use the returned cursor with the get entries method.

parameters.name: includeDeleted
parameters.description: Whether to include deleted entries, defaults to false.

parameters.name: verifyStream
parameters.description: Should the stream be verified, defaults to false.

parameters.description: Retrieve the entries in ascending/descending time order, defaults to Ascending.

verificationMethodId.description: The identity verification method to use for attesting the data.

namespace.description: The namespace of the connector to use for the attestation, defaults to component configured namespace.

AttestationCreateRequest.description: The data to be used in the signing.

id.description: The unique identifier of the attestation.

dateCreated.description: Created date/time of the attestation in ISO format.

dateTransferred.description: Transferred date/time of the attestation in ISO format, can be blank if holder identity is owner.

holderIdentity.description: The identity of the current holder, can be undefined if owner is still the holder.

verified.description: Whether the attestation has been verified.

AttestationInformation.description: Interface describing the collated attestation information.

AttestationTransferRequest.description: The parameters to be used in the transfer.

aliases.description: Alternative aliases that can be used to identify the vertex.

resources.description: The resources attached to the vertex.

edges.description: The edges connected to the vertex.

AuditableItemGraphCreateRequest.description: The data to be used in the vertex.

aliases.description: Alternative aliases that can be used to identify the vertex.

resources.description: The resources attached to the vertex.

edges.description: The edges connected to the vertex.

AuditableItemGraphUpdateRequest.description: The data to be used in the vertex.

AuditableItemStreamCreateEntryRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

immutableInterval.description: After how many entries do we add immutable checks, defaults to service configured value. A value of 0 will disable immutable checks, 1 will be every item, or any other integer for an interval.

AuditableItemStreamCreateRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

AuditableItemStreamUpdateEntryRequest.description: The data to be used in the entry.

AuditableItemStreamUpdateRequest.description: The data to be used in the stream.

blob.description: The data to store in base64 encoding.

encodingFormat.description: The mime type of the blob, will be detected if left undefined.

fileExtension.description: The extension of the blob, will be detected if left undefined.

namespace.description: The namespace to store the data in, defaults to component configured namespace.

dateCreated.description: The date/time when the entry was created.

dateModified.description: The date/time when the entry was modified.

blobSize.description: The size of the data in the blob.

encodingFormat.description: The mime type for the blob.

blob.description: The blob in base64 format, if the includeContent flag was set in the request.

BlobStorageEntry.description: Interface describing a blob storage entry.

cursor.description: The cursor to get the next chunk of entries.

BlobStorageEntryList.description: Interface describing an blob storage entry list.

encodingFormat.description: The mime type of the blob, will be detected if left undefined.

fileExtension.description: The extension of the blob, will be detected if left undefined.

properties.description: Any additional information for the error.

stack.description: The stack trace for the error.

ConflictResponse.description: The body which contains the error.

DidCredentialStatus.description: Interface describing a DID credential status.

anyOf.description: The type for EdDSA crypto suite for JSON Canonicalization Scheme [RFC8785]. https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-di-eddsa/#eddsa-jcs-2022
The type for EdDSA crypto suite for RDF Dataset Canonicalization. https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-di-eddsa/#eddsa-rdfc-2022

DidCryptoSuites.description: The types for DID Proof crypto suites.

DidDocument.description: Interface describing a DID Document. Spec https://www.w3.org/TR/did-core/#did-document-properties.

publicKeyMultibase.description: The public key for the entry. Spec https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/draft-multiformats-multibase-03 .

DidDocumentVerificationMethod.description: Interface describing a DID document verification method.

cryptosuite.description: An identifier for the cryptographic suite that can be used to verify the proof.

proofPurpose.description: The reason the proof was created.

proofValue.description: Contains the base-encoded binary data necessary to verify the digital proof using the verificationMethod specified.

verificationMethod.description: The verification method of the proof.

created.description: The iso date of when the proof was created.

expires.description: The iso date of when the proof expires.

domain.description: One or more security domains in which the proof is meant to be used.

challenge.description: Provided to mitigate replay attacks on domains.

previousProof.description: Identifies another data integrity proof that MUST verify before the current proof is processed

nonce.description: Use of this field is to increase privacy by decreasing linkability that is the result of deterministically generated signatures.

DidProof.description: Interface describing a did proof. https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-integrity/

DidService.description: Interface describing a did document service.

@context.description: The context for the verifiable credential.

id.description: The identifier for the verifiable credential.

type.description: The types of the data stored in the verifiable credential.

credentialSubject.description: The data for the verifiable credential.

issuanceDate.description: The date the verifiable credential was issued.

proof.description: Proofs that the verifiable credential is valid. Optional if a different proof method is used, such as JWT.

@context.description: The context for the verifiable presentation.

id.description: Provide a unique identifier for the presentation.

type.description: The types of the data stored in the verifiable credential.

verifiableCredential.description: The data for the verifiable credentials.

proof.description: Proofs that the verifiable presentation is valid. Optional if a different proof method is used, such as JWT.

properties.description: Any additional information for the error.

stack.description: The stack trace for the error.

HealthStatus.description: The health status of the component.

namespace.description: The optional namespace to create the identity in.

identity.description: The identity of the profile, this is the authenticated user identity.

cursor.description: An optional cursor, when defined can be used to call find to get more entities.

revocationIndex.description: The bitmap revocation index of the credential, if undefined will not have revocation status.

jwt.description: The JWT token for the verifiable credential.

verifiableCredentials.description: The verifiable credentials to include in the presentation.

expiresInMinutes.description: The expiration time for the presentation.

jwt.description: The JWT token for the verifiable presentation.

verificationMethodId.description: The optional id for the verification method, will be allocated if not supplied.

ImmutableProofFailure.description: The failure reason of the proof.

ImmutableProofVerification.description: Interface describing an immutable proof verification.

use.description: The intended use for the key.

key_ops.description: The operation(s) that the key is intended to be used for.

Jwk.description: The fields in a JSON Web Key.

JwtAlgorithms.description: The cryptographic algorithms supported for JSON Web Tokens and JSON Web Keys.

source.description: The source of the log entry.

ts.description: The timestamp of the log entry, if left blank will be populated by the connector.

entities.description: The entities, which can be partial if a limited keys list was provided.

cursor.description: An optional cursor, when defined can be used to call find to get more entities.

email.description: The email address for the user.

token.description: The access token, if it uses a mechanism with public access.

expiry.description: The expiry time of the token.

immutableMetadata.description: The immutable metadata for the NFT.

namespace.description: The namespace of the connector to use for the NFT, defaults to component configured namespace.

tag.description: The tag data for the NFT.

recipientIdentity.description: The recipient identity for the NFT.

recipientAddress.description: The recipient address for the NFT.

NftUpdateRequest.description: The data to be used in the update.

notFoundId.description: The id if the item that was not found.

stack.description: The stack trace for the error.

expiry.description: The expiry time of the token.

value.description: The value for the update operation.
